intro: Crotalaria heterophylla, commonly known as the variable cowpea or variable crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant exhibits significant morphological variation, with leaves that can be either palmate or trifoliate depending on environmental conditions. It is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine in some regions. Crotalaria heterophylla is also known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
